page.title: 01GRAEMSAY
page.content: Island has seven working crofts, two retired couples and one teacher. 27 residents and 4 secondary pupils in Stromness who travel home at weekends. Main crop is hay and silage to feed cattle and sheep bred on the island, then mostly sold to mainlabd Scotland for fattening. Most homes have mains electricity and water from private wells or springs, although a scheme is under way to pipe mains water from Hoy. The island is served by a passenger ferry 3 days a week (am and pm) supplemented by a weekly cargo boat. As there is no peat on Graemsay the principle fuel is coal, delivered from Stromness. The two lighthouses are now automaticm so there are no keepers. The school at present has two pupils, with a further three of pre-school age to follow.
